newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares leap 2.24 pct to new all-time high.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares leap 2.24 pct to new all-time high.

text.p: Istanbul shares jumped an average 2.24 percent in active and selective trade on Thursday, with the index hitting the week's fourth all-time high close in a row.
The IMKB-100 ended at a day's high of 90,740.86, up 1,991.87 points from Wednesday's previous record of 88,748.99. It gained 4.32 percent so far this week after last week's 5.38 percent surge.
Trade volume soared to 21.66 trillion lira from Wednesday's 17.93 trillion.
"The market looked good after piercing the 90,000 mark at mid-session (in the afternoon). There was strong selective activity," said a dealer who declined to be named.
The market had targeted the 90,000 barrier after overcoming stiff resistance at 85,000 last week.
Brokers said some fresh cash inflow and year-end profit prospects of companies fuelled demand in the second session.

Leading actives were industrial coglomerate Koc Holding, up 1,000 lira at 21,750, ground handling firm Celebi Hava Servisi, up 2,000 lira at 36,500 and T.Isbank's C series which gained 500 lira to end at 18,750. Together, the three made up 19.5 percent of the total turnover.

Of the 230 shares traded, rises outdid falls by 128 to 43 and 59 closed steady. The 85-share industrial index rose 2.2 percent to 94,820.38 and the 15-share financial index ended 2.34 percent higher at 89,950.94.
